comments:
I20060412-20xx

- open the "New Class" wizard
- press the help icon in the lower left

> help opens as expected, docked at the right of the wizard

> after a while, a dialog box pops up telling me about failed jobs due to SAXParseExceptions (see below)

-> I as a help-seeking user am not really interested in the exception. Since a problem with the indexed content is something that will occasionally happen and is not under the control of user assistance, this should be expected. Not even sure whether we have to tell the user (writing to the log seems enough).

-> along the lines of bug 131473, the message could be made more user friendly

-> the error dialog pops up on top, but is non-clickable as the wizard already is a modal dialog.

-> besides the SaxParseException, there is also an NPE.

-- Exceptions --

[Fatal Error] :21:55: The element type "img" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</img>".

!ENTRY org.eclipse.help 4 0 2006-04-13 18:11:48.623
!MESSAGE Parser error in line 21, uri null
The element type "img" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</img>".
!STACK 0

Agreed. Curtis fixed the problem in the files in question, but it will happen again.

Curtis, can we harden the XHTML Lucene search participant so that the offending document does not shut down the entire index?

We should not just silently fail on this though - a log entry is acceptable, and it is OK for JUnit test cases to fail. However, we should not open error messages like this.

Yes, I will track this as part of bug 136679.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 136679 ***

traces.message: The element type "img" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</img>".
